metas.name: Severance
metas.description: Given your appreciation for 'The Expanse' and 'Foundation', this show's intricate sci-fi mystery and corporate intrigue, coupled with its high stakes and dark, philosophical undertones, should be incredibly engaging.

metas.name: True Detective
metas.description: The gritty crime and psychological complexity of 'Mare of Easttown' and 'The Night Manager' align perfectly with the atmospheric, character-driven investigations and dark themes in 'True Detective'.

metas.name: Mr. Robot
metas.description: Your enjoyment of the complex narratives and psychological depth in shows like 'Atlanta' and the darker aspects of 'Rick and Morty' suggests you'll appreciate 'Mr. Robot's' exploration of hacking, mental health, and societal critique.

metas.name: Dark
metas.description: The intricate mystery and sci-fi elements of 'The Expanse' and 'Foundation', combined with the dark, complex narrative of 'Stranger Things', make this German sci-fi thriller a natural fit.

metas.name: Black Mirror
metas.description: You clearly enjoy thought-provoking sci-fi and dark themes with 'Love, Death & Robots' and 'Rick and Morty'. 'Black Mirror' delivers a similar anthology format, exploring the darker side of technology and humanity.

metas.name: The Leftovers
metas.description: The emotional complexity and profound thematic exploration you enjoyed in 'The Good Place' and 'Ted Lasso' will be met with 'The Leftovers', a show that delves into grief, faith, and the human condition with immense depth.

metas.name: Better Call Saul
metas.description: If you appreciated the character development and morally ambiguous nature of 'Atlanta' and 'Brassic', this prequel to 'Breaking Bad' offers a masterful study of a man's descent into a criminal underworld, filled with suspense and incredible performances.

metas.name: Barry
metas.description: You've listed 'Succession' as a dark comedy preference, and 'Barry' fits this perfectly. It blends dark humor with intense drama and psychological exploration of a hitman trying to become an actor.

metas.name: Fargo
metas.description: The crime, mystery, and dark humor you enjoyed in 'Mare of Easttown' and 'It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia' (for its dark humor aspects) will resonate with the Coen brothers-esque style and compelling crime narratives of 'Fargo'.

metas.name: Westworld
metas.description: Given your interest in 'The Expanse' and 'Foundation' for their sci-fi scope and complex world-building, 'Westworld' offers a philosophical exploration of artificial intelligence and consciousness with significant stakes.

metas.name: Sharp Objects
metas.description: The dark psychological mystery and small-town secrets explored in 'Mare of Easttown' are mirrored in this intense adaptation, delving into trauma and family dysfunction.

metas.name: The Americans
metas.description: For fans of high stakes, intense drama, and morally complex characters like those in 'The Night Manager', this Cold War-era spy thriller offers incredible tension and character depth.

metas.name: Ozark
metas.description: The gritty crime and high stakes you enjoyed in 'Mare of Easttown' and 'The Night Manager' are central to 'Ozark', a story of a financial planner laundering money for a drug cartel.

metas.name: Killing Eve
metas.description: The cat-and-mouse dynamic and dark, stylish thrill of 'The Night Manager' is present here, along with a strong psychological element that will appeal to your taste for intensity.

metas.name: Undone
metas.description: Your enjoyment of animated shows with complex themes ('Rick and Morty', 'Love, Death & Robots', 'Angels of Death') and 'The Good Place's' philosophical bent makes this rotoscoped series about time and reality a compelling choice.

metas.name: Russian Doll
metas.description: The blend of dark humor, existential themes, and mystery you've enjoyed in 'The Good Place' and 'Atlanta' will be amplified by this time-looping comedy-drama.

metas.name: Peaky Blinders
metas.description: The gritty crime, intense drama, and complex character arcs found in shows like 'Brassic' and 'Mare of Easttown' are central to this historical crime drama about a family in post-WWI Birmingham.

metas.name: Yellowjackets
metas.description: The mystery, survival elements, and dark psychological themes, reminiscent of 'Stranger Things' and 'Mare of Easttown', make this a gripping watch about a high school girls' soccer team stranded in the wilderness.

metas.name: Watchmen
metas.description: Your interest in 'Foundation' and 'The Expanse' for their ambitious sci-fi narratives, combined with the dark, complex storytelling of 'Stranger Things', will be met by this critically acclaimed superhero deconstruction.

metas.name: The Wire
metas.description: A landmark in gritty crime dramas, this show offers unparalleled realism and depth in its portrayal of the drug trade in Baltimore, resonating with your appreciation for 'Mare of Easttown' and 'The Night Manager'.

metas.name: Mindhunter
metas.description: The psychological depth and procedural elements similar to 'Mare of Easttown' and 'The Night Manager' are at the forefront, as FBI agents interview serial killers to understand their psychology.

metas.name: The OA
metas.description: If you enjoy the blend of sci-fi, mystery, and profound emotional depth found in 'The Good Place' and 'The Expanse', this enigmatic series offers a unique and thought-provoking narrative.

metas.name: Mr. Inbetween
metas.description: A hidden gem that shares the dark humor and morally gray protagonists with 'Barry' and 'It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia', this Australian series follows a hitman navigating life and crime.

metas.name: Bojack Horseman
metas.description: You've enjoyed animated shows with comedic and dramatic elements ('Rick and Morty', 'The Simpsons') and shows with emotional complexity ('The Good Place', 'Ted Lasso'). Bojack Horseman offers a brilliant, dark, and often heartbreaking look at depression and fame.

metas.name: Legion
metas.description: Your appreciation for the mind-bending sci-fi of 'Rick and Morty' and 'Dirk Gently's Holistic Detective Agency' suggests you'll enjoy the surreal, psychological, and visually stunning narrative of this X-Men universe series.

metas.name: The Fall
metas.description: Fans of 'Mare of Easttown' and 'The Night Manager' will appreciate the intense psychological cat-and-mouse game between a detective and a serial killer in this atmospheric thriller.

metas.name: Station Eleven
metas.description: The post-apocalyptic sci-fi elements you enjoyed in 'Fallout' and the emotional depth of 'The Good Place' are present in this critically acclaimed series about art and humanity's survival.

metas.name: The Haunting of Hill House
metas.description: Your interest in mystery and dark themes from 'Mare of Easttown' and 'Stranger Things' will be captivated by this masterclass in atmospheric horror and family drama.

metas.name: Orphan Black
metas.description: The intricate sci-fi plot and high stakes you liked in 'The Expanse' and 'Foundation' are present here, with a compelling central performance and a story of identity and conspiracy.

metas.name: Raised by Wolves
metas.description: Given your enjoyment of ambitious sci-fi like 'Foundation' and 'The Expanse', this Ridley Scott-produced series offers a visually stunning and philosophically charged exploration of faith, humanity, and artificial intelligence.

metas.name: Happy Valley
metas.description: This is another highly acclaimed gritty crime drama with incredible character work and intense stakes, much like 'Mare of Easttown', offering a compelling look at life in a Northern English town.

metas.name: Carnivàle
metas.description: For those who appreciate complex narratives, dark themes, and a touch of the supernatural, this show offers a richly detailed, atmospheric journey set during the Great Depression.

metas.name: Boardwalk Empire
metas.description: The historical setting and gritty crime elements you enjoyed in 'Peaky Blinders' will find a home here, with a complex narrative about organized crime and politics during Prohibition.

metas.name: Alias Grace
metas.description: This historical mystery drama, based on Margaret Atwood's novel, offers a complex psychological puzzle and dark themes that should appeal to fans of 'Mare of Easttown' and 'Sharp Objects'.

metas.name: Devs
metas.description: If you enjoy mind-bending sci-fi, philosophical questions, and a controlled, intense atmosphere like 'Severance' and 'Black Mirror', this FX series offers a visually stunning and thought-provoking experience.

metas.name: Atlanta
metas.description: You've already watched this, but it perfectly fits the 'dark comedy' and 'emotional complexity' criteria with its unique blend of surrealism, social commentary, and character depth. If you enjoyed it, consider its follow-ups for similar vibes.

metas.name: Peep Show
metas.description: You have listed this, and its internal monologue style and painfully awkward, dark humor are a prime example of what makes dark comedy so compelling. If you enjoyed it, exploring more shows with that raw, uncomfortable realism is a good path.

metas.name: His Dark Materials
metas.description: Your enjoyment of 'The Expanse' and 'Foundation' for their epic sci-fi scope and intricate world-building, along with the fantasy elements in 'Rick and Morty' and 'Angels of Death', makes this a strong contender.

metas.name: Halt and Catch Fire
metas.description: The character-driven drama and exploration of ambition and technological change, reminiscent of the thematic depth in 'The Good Place' and the character arcs in 'Atlanta', make this a compelling watch.
